title: (x) 2 typefaces from Übungsgrammatik - ITC Stone (Sans and Serif) {Florian}
content:
Hello!

Could someone please tell me which two fonts were used in this book (for example, on page 6):

[http://books.google.com/books?id=19xQzkoDOKwC&printsec=frontcover&dq=Ren...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016001541/http:/books.google.com/books?id=19xQzkoDOKwC&printsec=frontcover&dq=Renate+Luscher&client=firefox-a&cd=3#v=onepage&q=&f=false "http://books.google.com/books?id=19xQzkoDOKwC&printsec=frontcover&dq=Renate+Luscher&client=firefox-a&cd=3#v=onepage&q=&f=false")

If the link doesn't work, just type Übungsgrammatik für Anfänger: Deutsch als Fremdsprache in Google Books!

Thank you!
author: Sylph

comments.content:
Hi John,  
that's the [ITC Stone Superfamily](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016001541/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super_families/itc_stone/) (Sans Bold and Serif Medium with italics).  
F

Thank you, Florian, very much!

I love this font and German type design. Very clean, neat, transparent. :) I really thought these were two different types!

You’re welcome!  
German type design? [Sumner Stone](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016001541/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/aboutsumnerstone.html) is an American.
Oh, I meant how Germans design books in general, the layout in that grammar is by a woman who works for Typographische Gesellschaft München. :)
